summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. It alleges Epstein, with the help of employees and associates, sexually exploited dozens of underage girls between 2002 and 2005 at his residences in New York and Florida, using a scheme where victims were paid to recruit other minors.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly worked with several employees and associates to facilitate his abuse scheme by contacting victims and scheduling encounters.
Epstein paid certain victims to recruit additional underage girls for him to abuse, creating a network of victims.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on Saturday, July 6, 2019.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed
events.description: The indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy was unsealed in Manhattan federal court.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking Period
events.description: The indictment alleges Epstein sexually exploited dozens of underage girls between at least 2002 and 2005.

locations: New York, New York (specifically his mansion/residence on the Upper East Side)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The alleged scheme involved Epstein paying victims hundreds of dollars in cash for sexual encounters and paying some victims to recruit other underage girls.
Epstein's alleged victims were as young as 14 and were recruited under the guise of providing 'massages' which escalated to sexual acts.
The indictment alleges Epstein operated this abuse network in both New York, NY and Palm Beach, FL.
The document notes the involvement of unnamed employees and associates who helped schedule encounters and contact victims.
